mpmToolbox.projectData

Class ProjectData

  • java.lang.Object
    • mpmToolbox.projectData.ProjectData

  • public class ProjectData
extends java.lang.Object
    The data structure of an MPM Toolbox project.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Audio> audio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProjectData(java.io.File file)
      constructor, instantiate a project from a project file
      ProjectData(meico.mei.Mei mei)
      constructor, the MEI input is converted to MSM and MPM; if the MEI has more than one mdiv, only the first is converted to MSM and MPM; use mei.exportMsmMpm() directly and choose the desired MSM from the output to instantiate a ProgramData object.
      ProjectData(meico.midi.Midi midi)
      constructor, the MIDI input is converted to MSM
      ProjectData(meico.msm.Msm msm)
      constructor

        public ProjectData(meico.mei.Mei mei)
        constructor, the MEI input is converted to MSM and MPM; if the MEI has more than one mdiv, only the first is converted to MSM and MPM; use mei.exportMsmMpm() directly and choose the desired MSM from the output to instantiate a ProgramData object.

      • addScorePdf

        public java.util.ArrayList<ScorePage> addScorePdf(java.io.File pdf)
        This extracts each page of the input PDF file, stores them as PNG in the input file's directory and adds those PNGs to the score.
        Parameters:
        pdf -
        Returns:
        an arraylist of the score pages just added

      • saveProject

        public boolean saveProject()
        Save the project under its already defined filename. If it is not defined (in this.xml) it returns false.
        Returns:

      • saveProjectAs

        public boolean saveProjectAs(java.io.File file)
        This saves the project in an .mpr file, basically an xml file which stores relative paths to all other project files. If the MSM or MPM file was not existent in the file system, they will be created in the directory.
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:
